channel.title: The Productivity in Tech Podcast
channel.itunes:summary:
Weekly podcast where I sit down and talk with people in tech that love productivity.
Or at least love talking about it.
channel.itunes:author: Jay Miller
channel.description:
Weekly podcast where I sit down and talk with people in tech that love productivity.
Or at least love talking about it.

item.title: PIT Reflections 03: Proactive vs Reactive Work and Essentialism
item.description:
PIT Reflections 03:

Today's Buffer Chat on Essentialism made me wonder about whether my job was proactive or reactive. This is very much like the conversation I had with Rob Freelow.

Proactive - working towards and thinking about the things that you would like to have instead of what is already there.

Reactive - working on the things that are already in existence.

Essentialism - Making sure that you have an understanding of what is most important at the moment #bufferchat

Links
#BufferChat - Buffer - A Smarter Way to Share on Social Media

Pit 32: Being A Background Superstar With Rob Frelow



Join one (or more) of our Social Network Communities

item.itunes:subtitle: September 28, 2016

item.title: PIT Reflections 02: Being Authentic But Knowing Your Audience
item.description:
Productivity in Tech Reflections

Well I tried to be myself... Too bad the people I was talking to didn't really care about that.

I'm learned another valuable lesson today. While it is important to be authentic and true to yourself. You have to remember that not everyone will be the audience that you are expecting them to be.

The world isn't made of your cheerleaders shouting "Rah Rah Rah" for you. They have their own agenda.

Today I wanted people to talk about being productive, but they just wanted to talk about their products.

Overall my first conference was somewhat of a let down, I absolutely enjoyed the mixer and I think I could have did a lot of things better.

  • Listened to more talks
  • Did less Interviews
  • Talk with people mostly about their journey and not about what I wanted them to talk about (created friends instead of clients.)

I did meet a few people that I really enjoyed talking to. I wish I would have spent more time meeting people like that instead of scheduling interviews.

That's okay I have some interviews and I have to make the best of it.

Thoughts for the day:

  • Be Authentic but remember your audience
  • Cherish the relationships you can create over the business opportunities

Well, it's back to work tomorrow. I'm looking for to working with this new outlook, even if I'm not the most happy to return to work.

Links

  • Startup Grind
item.itunes:subtitle: September 27, 2016

item.title: PIT Reflections: 01 Fear, Anxiety, and Doing You
item.description:
Productivity in Tech

Daily Reflections

Daily reflections is a audio journal that I am sharing with you guys. I hope this will inspire you to record your thoughts and use them to come up with insights to guide you through your week.

Last night was the Startup Grind Mixer. I was nervous. I had never talked with so many people about what I do. I planned to talk about my consultation stuff but it dawned on me.

I'M A FREAKING PODCASTER.

This lead me to just start interviewing people. I had so much fun and met a lot of great people.

Today is Startup Grind. I'm super excited to go to my first conference.

Thoughts for the day:

  • - Pay it Forward
  • - Don't worry about things that are you instead focus on what is.

Links

  • This Developing Story
  • Interview with Chad Bostick
  • Startup Grind

item.title: PIT 31: SPECIAL EDITION - The Trigg Life Mapper
item.description:
This week I am releasing a special edition of the Productivity in Tech Podcast. I got to review the Trigg Life Mapper and I thought we would do a special episode in honor of their KickStarter starting September 20th.

The Trigg Life Mapper (or Trigg for short) is a colorful diary that helps you to plan your life. It focuses on Productivity, Mindfulness, and Work/Life Balance.

On this special episode I sat down with Trigg founder Matthew Bennet to learn more about him and his amazing notebook.

item.title: PIT 30: Turning Upset into Success with Chad Bostick
item.description:
This week we are hearing from Chad Bostick. I was lucky enough to be a guest on on Chad's show Hello Tech Pros where I got to talk about my productivity mindset. Chad returned the favor by dropping a Productivity BOMB on the show.

This week Chad tells us about his show as well as how he was able get it off the ground after being laid off 3 times in less than three years.

Chad Bostick

HelloTechPros.com

@hellotechpros

Links

item.title: PIT 28: A Good Meeting with Vyte Maker Martin St. Macary
item.description:
For the past few months I've been testing a scheduling tool called vyte. Several of the latest interviews were scheduled using vyte and I must say I'm quite impressed. Not just with the product but with the team that runs it.

I sat down with Martin St. Macary the company, one of the product's creators. It would be way too easy to talk about his product so instead we talked about why the need for such a product some of his own tricks to for handling meetings.

Martin St. Macary

Vyte.in

Twitter - @saintmac

Friend of the Show

This week's friend of the Show is That Mac Nerd

item.title: PIT 27: The Analog Black Belt with Erik Jenks
item.description:
This week, I have Developer and Consultant Erik Jenks.

As a martial artist, Erik uses the same discipline that got him his black belt to ensure that he is able to accomplish the goals and tasks that he encounters regularly.

Erik also practices Analog productivity which means Notebooks, Pens, and Paper.

item.title: Pit 25: @Saronyitbarek Asks About Productivity with Body Issues
item.description:
SoloSaturday is the show where I jump on the mic and talk about whatever in the world of productivity I feel like.

This week Saron Yitbarek (@saronyitbarek) asked us this question:

How do you stay productive when your body isn't cooperating?

Interesting Articles about This:

You Are Not A Machine - ThatMacNerd

sleep-debt - Hectic-Dad.com

Both articles emphasize taking care of yourself.

I have three points that I share with you.

  1. Address or Alleviate the problem immediately
  2. Reduce the amount of Time and Energy spent on the work you do
  3. Give yourself some slack and take it easy.

Carl is the author of *Your Digital Life* which teaches us how to better organize ourselves in this ever growing digital world. He recently made the switch to Todoist and wanted to document his journey. This has grown into an YouTube channel with over one thousand subscribers in his first few months.

Lets see how Kara helps others be productive while being productive herself.

item.title: Ep. 9: There's No "One Size Fits All" Solution with Jamal Hansen
item.description:
This week I sat down with my good friend and “OG” CodeNewbie PythonThursday co-horde Jamal Hansen.

We talked about his “Unique” productivity system and some the issues that we have with the “One size fits all productivity tools out there”

Jamal Hansen

My Sketchnotes of the Show

Links

  • Bullet Journal
  • Jamal’s Productivity System
  • Episode 1 with Francesco
  • CodeNewbie Podcast - Una Kravitz

item.title: Ep. 6: Dealing with Data, Tasks, and People with Craig Harrison (Part 1)
item.description:
This is part one of my two part conversation with Craig Harrison. Craig is a Data Manager by day and professional photographer by night.

With this split life, there are a lot of things Craig has to keep track of. So much stuff we had to split the show in half.

This week we are talking about his day job and how he deals with all the data and tasks that come his way.

Craig Harrison

  • Photography
  • Twitter

Ask us your questions

Send us a tweet @ProdTechPodcast and use the hashtag "#PITQuestions" and our productivity hounds will research and try to find an answer to your question. 

Get the full conversation now for just $1!!

If you pledge at least $1 to our patreon

We now have a Slack Team!!

You can join the Productivity in Tech Community everyday in our Slack Team.

item.title: Ep 5: SoloSaturday - Much Rest Needed
item.description:
I've been hitting it pretty hard. So hard that I got sick.

Well I decided that it was time to do something.

Hence the introduction of #SoloSaturday.

SoloSaturday will be every fifth episode and it will be about whatever I'm thinking about at the time. (I'll try to keep it productivity related).

So this week I talk about the much needed rest.

SketchNote of this week's Episode

Links and Shownotes

  • Pomodoro Technique
  • Office Exercises
  • Francesco D'Alessio
  • Todoist Videos on Priorities
  • Todoist Filters
  • Coach.me

item.title: Ep4: Learning as you Go with Craig Lang
item.description:
I would love to learn a new skill. Maybe even change professions one day. I don't think I would want to do both at the same time.

This is what former electronic engineer turned software developer had to do.

Listen to how Craig managed to become a lead software developer over the span of 13 years and how he used his growing knowledge to increase his productivity along the way.

Shameless Plugging

If you want to hear the entire hour plus conversation, consider pledging $1 or more a month to our Patreon Page.

Be sure to ask us some productivity questions on twitter using the #PITQuestions Hastag.

While you're there make you follow us.

@ProdTechPodcast

@kjaymiller

Craig Lang

  • cmlang.com
  • Twitter - Cmlang42

Links and Shownotes

My Sketchnotes of the Show

  • Pocket
  • Craig's Notebooks

Leuchtturm1917 Notebook

item.title: Ep3: Doing ONLY What you Like with Nick Foscolos
item.description:
This week I spoke with my friend Nick for the first time. We discussed his "only if I like it lifestyle". Nick explains how a near-death experience changed his outlook on life and how to cherish the things he liked to do and to eliminate the other stuff.

New Patreon Subcribers

Shout-outs this week go to:

    • Jamal Hansen
    • Craig Lang
    • Lee Tratnyek

These three (And all the other pattern subscribers receive all of the full (unedited conversations) as well as any other bonus content.

If you would like to support the show and receive your own shout-out, please visit patreon.com/kjaymiller and pledge at least $1.

My Notes from the Show

Sketch notes from other show available here!
